messages.title: Time to Move Britain Forward
messages.content: No more delays, no more gridlock. Let's get stuff done. Great Britan. Better hospitals. Safer streets. Improved schools.

messages.title: Royston Smith's plan for Southampton Itchen
messages.content: The months of MPs' attempts to implement the result of the EU referendum are to blame, not Brexit itself. It's time for a general election to break the gridlock. Royston knows this community and will focus on what counts.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: The focus promises on Brexit deal adjustments which deliver the referendum's promise, ending continued extensions and no more debates on the same issues.
A commitment to tackle crime and provide security with the addition of 20,000 more police officers.
Investing more funds into education to elevate school standards.
Investment in transport, with specific mention of £5 billion to devolve control of services and focus on bus services, cycling and roads where cars aren't suitable.

mentions.otherPartyLeaderCandidate: Jo Swinson, Jeremy Corbyn, Nicola Sturgeon
mentions.tacticalSituation: Tactical situation referenced regarding risk of a split vote leading to Jeremy Corbyn becoming Prime Minister.

issues.economy: More money to invest in priorities.
issues.education: Funding better terms for every child in every public school.
issues.governance: Break gridlock in Parliament with general election.

leaflet.personalStatement: Royston knows this community and will focus on what counts.

images.caption: Royston Smith working with local police.

leaflet.additionalNotes: Leaflet focuses on contrasting Conservative plans with perceived risks of a Labour or coalition government. Highlights the situation where tactical voting is essential to prevent a non-Conservative majority.
